headline: DHR rises after strong quarterly automation orders, management cites renewed demand in lab and diagnostics automation.
AbbVie shares climb as new immunology drug posts better‑than‑expected trial data, lifting near‑term revenue outlook.
Netflix falls amid slowing subscriber additions and higher churn in North America, prompting concerns over content spend.
ExxonMobil retreats after refining margins compress and downstream volumes miss seasonal expectations.
Wells Fargo slides as loan growth softens and credit costs tick up, weighing on quarter‑ahead guidance.
Philip Morris slips after weaker cigarette volume in key European markets offsets pricing gains.
Coca‑Cola steady as sparkling beverage volumes rebound and syrup pricing improves margins across international markets.
Amazon down following softer cloud guidance; AWS growth cools as enterprise AI capex moderates.
Broadcom pressured after semiconductor customers trim orders for networking chips amid inventory normalization.
JPMorgan underperforms after trading revenues decline and capital markets activity lags expectations.
Merck advances on positive oncology trial readouts and upbeat commentary about commercial launches.
Home Depot retreats as seasonal renovation demand softens and same‑store sales miss estimates.
Tesla dips after deliveries miss Street forecasts and competition in EV price tiers intensifies.
Alphabet pressured as advertising growth cools and YouTube monetization misses analyst models.
Costco pulls back on margin pressure from higher logistics costs despite continued membership growth.
Visa weakens amid slowing cross‑border volumes and cautious consumer spending trends.
Johnson & Johnson gains after pipeline updates and stable consumer health sales soothe investor concerns.
Procter & Gamble climbs as price realization and cost savings offset input cost headwinds in the quarter.
Abbott jumps on stronger device sales and expanding adoption of diagnostics platforms in hospitals.
Berkshire Hathaway steadies as diversified holdings benefit from insurance float and industrial earnings.
Apple retreats despite iPhone unit growth—services revenue slows and macro uncertainty dents guidance.
Chevron down after downstream margins compress and capex guidance disappoints relative to peers.
Verizon edges higher as fiber and 5G enterprise deals support service revenue momentum.
Bank of America slips on weaker mortgage origination volumes and slowing consumer lending growth.
UPS rises after holiday shipping volumes ramp and management flags better network efficiency.
Disney under pressure as theme‑park attendance lags and streaming losses remain elevated.
Meta shares fall amid lower ad demand and higher AI infrastructure spending weighing on margins.
Microsoft gains on robust cloud backlog and enterprise AI deal announcements boosting Azure demand.
Intel weakens after wallet‑share losses in data center chips and continued manufacturing cost pressures.
UnitedHealth retreats as medical cost trends accelerate and margin outlook is revised downward.
McDonald’s climbs as menu price mix and strong comps in international markets lift margins.
Thermo Fisher slides after lower consumables demand and tougher comps in lab equipment sales.
Comcast edges up as broadband subscriber additions beat estimates and content licensing revenue improves.
PepsiCo inches higher on stronger beverage volume and early cost‑saving program benefits.
Walmart rises as same‑store sales beat expectations and inventory levels normalize ahead of holidays.
Eli Lilly gains after encouraging diabetes drug uptake and optimistic commentary on late‑stage candidates.
Salesforce falls as license growth decelerates and customers push back on large‑scale CRM rollouts.
Accenture slips after softer consulting demand in telecom and media weighs on short‑term bookings.
Adobe retreats as creative cloud subscription growth slows and FX headwinds hit international sales.
Cisco steadies with improving enterprise spending on networking gear and cautious service‑chain recovery.
NVIDIA pulls back after a period of heavy multiple expansion and signs of cooling AI accelerator demand.
Nike rises on stronger than expected wholesale replenishment and solid direct‑to‑consumer growth.
AMD down as competitive pressure in data center GPUs and inventory digestion weigh on near‑term results.
Mastercard softens with lower cross‑border travel volumes and muted consumer spending trends.
Texas Instruments slides after industrial end‑market weakness and conservative guidance for next quarter.
